remarks.para: EICAS and/or STANDBY indications for one engine may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Appropriate procedures, AOM limitations, and performance decrements are applied,
Fuel flow indications for associated engine are operative, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.
Verify that N1, N2 and fuel flow systems on the affected engine are operating normally.
Reduced thrust operation using the assumed temperature method is not permitted.
Use of Derate 1 and Derate 2 thrust is not permitted.
Use of autothrottle is not permitted.
Apply the performance weight decrements in Limitations/Performance Penalties section.
No adjustments to takeoff speeds are required for the N1 thrust setting.

Procedures are unchanged except N1 power settings are used in lieu of EPR. For takeoff, thrust levers are advanced to 60% N1 prior to brake release or as the aircraft is aligned with the runway. Set takeoff N1 by 80 knots.

Use the following charts to determine % N1 for Maximum Takeoff, Maximum Climb, Maximum Cruise, Maximum Go-Around, and Maximum Continuous. Determine other thrust settings by use of N1 from engine with operative EPR indication.

entry.para: ENGINE A/I ON OR OFF UP TO 10°C

table.title: PW2040 % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING CLIMB

entry.para: VALID FOR 2 PACKS ON, ENG AND WING A/I OFF

table.title: PW2040 % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING CRUISE

entry.para: VALID FOR 2 PACKS ON, ENG AND WING A/I OFF

table.title: PW2040 % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING GO-AROUND

entry.para: ENGINE A/I ON OR OFF UP TO 10°C

table.title: RPW2040 % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING MAX CONT % N11 ENGINE INOP

entry.para: VALID FOR 1 A/C PACL ON EEC OFF
ONE PACK ON NORMAL FLOW WITH APU OFF

table.title: PW2040 1 ENGINE INOP % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING MAX CONT % N 1

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.
Use of pushbutton derate operation for takeoff and/or Climb not permitted.
Reduced thrust using Assumed Temperature method not permitted.
Use of autothrottle not permitted.
Use of improved climb performance is not permitted.
Observe limitations:
Takeoff Runway Limit Wt. when limited by VMBE, RNWY, TIRE: 2,400 lbs.
Takeoff Runway Limit weight limited by obstacle clearance: 9,400 lbs.
Takeoff Climb Limit Wt. 5,600 lbs.
Climb Limit Wt. for Landing 6,000 lbs..
Method 1/Method 2 Terrain Clearance Climb Limit Wt. 8,600 lbs.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "L (R) EPR INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: See MM 73-21-00 for information concerning Pratt & Whitney engine N1 speed and EICAS message logic.
Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
